field.name: MR0INT
field.description: Interrupt Flag for Match Channel 0 Event

field.name: MR1INT
field.description: Interrupt Flag for Match Channel 1 Event

field.name: MR2INT
field.description: Interrupt Flag for Match Channel 2 Event

field.name: MR3INT
field.description: Interrupt Flag for Match Channel 3 Event

field.name: CR0INT
field.description: Interrupt Flag for Capture Channel 0 Event

field.name: CR1INT
field.description: Interrupt Flag for Capture Channel 1 Event

field.name: CR2INT
field.description: Interrupt Flag for Capture Channel 2 Event

field.name: CR3INT
field.description: Interrupt Flag for Capture Channel 3 Event

field.name: CAP0I
field.description: Generate Interrupt on Channel 0 Capture Event

field.name: CAP1I
field.description: Generate Interrupt on Channel 1 Capture Event

field.name: CAP2I
field.description: Generate Interrupt on Channel 2 Capture Event

field.name: CAP3I
field.description: Generate Interrupt on Channel 3 Capture Event

field.name: RESULT
field.description: Indicates the measurement result-either the target clock counter value (for Frequency Measurement mode) or pulse width measurement (for Pulse Width Measurement mode)

enumeratedValue.name: RESET
enumeratedValue.description: Watchdog event has occurred (causes a chip reset if WDRESET = 1).

enumeratedValue.name: HALT
enumeratedValue.description: Any error causes the HALT field to be set to 1

enumeratedValue.name: STALL
enumeratedValue.description: Stall the start of any new channels

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLE
enumeratedValue.description: Channel linking disabled for all channels

enumeratedValue.name: AVAILABLE
enumeratedValue.description: Channel linking available and controlled by each channel's link settings

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLE
enumeratedValue.description: Initiator ID replication disabled for all channels

enumeratedValue.name: AVAILABLE
enumeratedValue.description: Initiator ID replication available and controlled by each channel's CHn_SBR[EMI] setting

enumeratedValue.name: BUS_ERROR
enumeratedValue.description: Last recorded error was a bus error on a destination write

enumeratedValue.name: BUS_ERROR
enumeratedValue.description: Last recorded error was a bus error on a source read

enumeratedValue.name: CONFIGURATION_ERROR
enumeratedValue.description: Last recorded error was a configuration error detected in the TCDn_DLAST_SGA field

enumeratedValue.name: CONFIGURATION_ERROR
enumeratedValue.description: The last recorded error was NBYTES equal to zero or a CITER not equal to BITER error

enumeratedValue.name: CONFIGURATION_ERROR
enumeratedValue.description: Last recorded error was a configuration error detected in the TCDn_DOFF field

enumeratedValue.name: CONFIGURATION_ERROR
enumeratedValue.description: Last recorded error was a configuration error detected in the TCDn_DADDR field

enumeratedValue.name: CONFIGURATION_ERROR
enumeratedValue.description: Last recorded error was a configuration error detected in the TCDn_SOFF field

enumeratedValue.name: CONFIGURATION_ERROR
enumeratedValue.description: Last recorded error was a configuration error detected in the TCDn_SADDR field

enumeratedValue.name: CANCELED_TRANSFER
enumeratedValue.description: Last recorded entry was a canceled transfer by the error cancel transfer input

field.name: ERRCHN
field.description: Error Channel Number or Canceled Channel Number

enumeratedValue.name: NO_FIELD_SET_ONE
enumeratedValue.description: No CHn_ES[ERR] fields are set to 1

enumeratedValue.name: ATLEAST_ONE_FIELD
enumeratedValue.description: At least one CHn_ES[ERR] field is set to 1, indicating a valid error exists that software has not cleared

cluster.name: TCD[%s]
cluster.description: Array of registers: CH_CSR, CH_ES, CH_INT, CH_MUX, CH_PRI, CH_SBR, TCD_ATTR, TCD_BITER_ELINKNO, TCD_BITER_ELINKYES, TCD_CITER_ELINKNO, TCD_CITER_ELINKYES, TCD_CSR, TCD_DADDR, TCD_DLAST_SGA, TCD_DOFF, TCD_NBYTES_MLOFFNO, TCD_NBYTES_MLOFFYES, TCD_SADDR, TCD_SLAST_SDA, TCD_SOFF

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLE
enumeratedValue.description: DMA hardware request signal for corresponding channel disabled

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLE
enumeratedValue.description: DMA hardware request signal for corresponding channel enabled

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLE
enumeratedValue.description: Disable asynchronous DMA request for the channel

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLE
enumeratedValue.description: Enable asynchronous DMA request for the channel

enumeratedValue.name: NO_ERROR
enumeratedValue.description: Error signal for corresponding channel does not generate error interrupt

enumeratedValue.name: ERROR
enumeratedValue.description: Assertion of error signal for corresponding channel generates error interrupt request

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLE
enumeratedValue.description: Buffered writes on system bus disabled

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLE
enumeratedValue.description: Buffered writes on system bus enabled

enumeratedValue.name: ERROR
enumeratedValue.description: Last recorded error was bus error on destination write

enumeratedValue.name: ERROR
enumeratedValue.description: Last recorded error was bus error on source read

enumeratedValue.name: ERROR
enumeratedValue.description: Last recorded error was a configuration error detected in the TCDn_DLAST_SGA field

enumeratedValue.name: ERROR
enumeratedValue.description: Last recorded error was a configuration error detected in the TCDn_NBYTES or TCDn_CITER fields

enumeratedValue.name: ERROR
enumeratedValue.description: Last recorded error was a configuration error detected in the TCDn_DOFF field

enumeratedValue.name: ERROR
enumeratedValue.description: Last recorded error was a configuration error detected in the TCDn_DADDR field

enumeratedValue.name: ERROR
enumeratedValue.description: Last recorded error was a configuration error detected in the TCDn_SOFF field

enumeratedValue.name: ERROR
enumeratedValue.description: Last recorded error was a configuration error detected in the TCDn_SADDR field

enumeratedValue.name: NO_ERROR
enumeratedValue.description: An error in this channel has not occurred

enumeratedValue.name: ERROR
enumeratedValue.description: An error in this channel has occurred

enumeratedValue.name: INTERRUPT_CLEARED
enumeratedValue.description: Interrupt request for corresponding channel cleared

enumeratedValue.name: INTERRUPT_ACTIVE
enumeratedValue.description: Interrupt request for corresponding channel active

enumeratedValue.name: USER_PROTECTION
enumeratedValue.description: User protection level for DMA transfers

enumeratedValue.name: PRIVILEGED_PROTECTION
enumeratedValue.description: Privileged protection level for DMA transfers

enumeratedValue.name: SUSPEND
enumeratedValue.description: Channel can suspend a lower-priority channel

enumeratedValue.name: CANNOT_SUSPEND
enumeratedValue.description: Channel cannot suspend any other channel, regardless of channel priority

enumeratedValue.name: CANNOT_SUSPEND
enumeratedValue.description: Channel cannot be suspended by a higher-priority channel's service request

enumeratedValue.name: SUSPEND
enumeratedValue.description: Channel can be temporarily suspended by a higher-priority channel's service request

register.name: TCD_NBYTES_MLOFFNO
register.description: TCD Transfer Size Without Minor Loop Offsets

field.name: NBYTES
field.description: Number of Bytes To Transfer Per Service Request

enumeratedValue.name: OFFSET_NOT_APPLIED
enumeratedValue.description: Minor loop offset not applied to DADDR

enumeratedValue.name: OFFSET_APPLIED
enumeratedValue.description: Minor loop offset applied to DADDR

enumeratedValue.name: OFFSET_NOT_APPLIED
enumeratedValue.description: Minor loop offset not applied to SADDR

enumeratedValue.name: OFFSET_APPLIED
enumeratedValue.description: Minor loop offset applied to SADDR

register.name: TCD_NBYTES_MLOFFYES
register.description: TCD Transfer Size with Minor Loop Offsets

field.name: NBYTES
field.description: Number of Bytes To Transfer Per Service Request

enumeratedValue.name: OFFSET_NOT_APPLIED
enumeratedValue.description: Minor loop offset not applied to DADDR

enumeratedValue.name: OFFSET_APPLIED
enumeratedValue.description: Minor loop offset applied to DADDR

enumeratedValue.name: OFFSET_NOT_APPLIED
enumeratedValue.description: Minor loop offset not applied to SADDR

enumeratedValue.name: OFFSET_APPLIED
enumeratedValue.description: Minor loop offset applied to SADDR

register.name: TCD_SLAST_SDA
register.description: TCD Last Source Address Adjustment / Store DADDR Address

field.name: SLAST_SDA
field.description: Last Source Address Adjustment / Store DADDR Address

register.name: TCD_CITER_ELINKNO
register.description: TCD Current Major Loop Count (Minor Loop Channel Linking Disabled)

register.name: TCD_CITER_ELINKYES
register.description: TCD Current Major Loop Count (Minor Loop Channel Linking Enabled)

register.name: TCD_DLAST_SGA
register.description: TCD Last Destination Address Adjustment / Scatter Gather Address

field.name: DLAST_SGA
field.description: Last Destination Address Adjustment / Scatter Gather Address

enumeratedValue.name: CHANNEL_STARTED
enumeratedValue.description: Channel explicitly started via a software-initiated service request

field.name: INTMAJOR
field.description: Enable Interrupt If Major count complete

field.name: INTHALF
field.description: Enable Interrupt If Major Counter Half-complete

enumeratedValue.name: ERQ_FIELD_CLEAR
enumeratedValue.description: Clear the ERQ field to 0 upon major loop completion, thus disabling hardware service requests

enumeratedValue.name: NORMAL_FORMAT
enumeratedValue.description: Current channel's TCD is normal format

enumeratedValue.name: SCATTER_GATHER_FORMAT
enumeratedValue.description: Current channel's TCD specifies scatter/gather format.

field.name: MAJORELINK
field.description: Enable Link When Major Loop Complete

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLE
enumeratedValue.description: Ability to store destination address to system memory disabled

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLE
enumeratedValue.description: Ability to store destination address to system memory enabled

enumeratedValue.name: ENGINE_STALLS_FOUR
enumeratedValue.description: eDMA engine stalls for 4 cycles after each R/W

enumeratedValue.name: ENGINE_STALLS_EIGHT
enumeratedValue.description: eDMA engine stalls for 8 cycles after each R/W

register.name: TCD_BITER_ELINKNO
register.description: TCD Beginning Major Loop Count (Minor Loop Channel Linking Disabled)

register.name: TCD_BITER_ELINKYES
register.description: TCD Beginning Major Loop Count (Minor Loop Channel Linking Enabled)

field.name: FXOR
field.description: Complement Read of CRC Data Register

enumeratedValue.name: INVERT
enumeratedValue.description: Inverts or complements the read value of the CRC Data.

enumeratedValue.name: BTS_TRNPS
enumeratedValue.description: Bits in bytes are transposed, but bytes are not transposed.

enumeratedValue.name: BYTS_BTS_TRNPS
enumeratedValue.description: Both bits in bytes and bytes are transposed.

enumeratedValue.name: BYTS_TRNPS
enumeratedValue.description: Only bytes are transposed, no bits in a byte are transposed.

enumeratedValue.name: BTS_TRNPS
enumeratedValue.description: Bits in bytes are transposed, but bytes are not transposed.

enumeratedValue.name: BYTS_BTS_TRNPS
enumeratedValue.description: Both bits in bytes and bytes are transposed.

enumeratedValue.name: BYTS_TRNPS

enumeratedValue.description: Core, platform, and peripheral clocks are off, and core enters Low-Power mode

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Flash memory is not disabled during flash memory accesses

field.name: CPU0_SBUS
field.description: CPU0 S-AHB bus master priority level

field.name: DMA0
field.description: DMA0 controller bus master priority level

field.name: IRQCPU0
field.description: The IRQ number of the interrupt that acts as the Non-Maskable Interrupt (NMI) for CPU0, if enabled by NMIENCPU0.

field.name: NMIENCPU0
field.description: Enables the Non-Maskable Interrupt (NMI) source selected by IRQCPU0.

field.name: PRIV
field.description: Control privileged access of EIM, ERM, Flexcan, MBC, SCG, DMA, ROMCP and Flexspi.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLE
enumeratedValue.description: privileged access is disabled. the peripherals could be access in user mode.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLE
enumeratedValue.description: privileged access is enabled. the peripherals could be access in privilege mode.

field.name: LOCKNSMPU
field.description: Control write access to Nonsecure MPU memory regions.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLE
enumeratedValue.description: Unlock these registers. privileged access to Nonsecure MPU memory regions is allowed.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLE
enumeratedValue.description: Disable writes to the MPU_CTRL_NS, MPU_RNR_NS, MPU_RBAR_NS, MPU_RLAR_NS, MPU_RBAR_A_NSn and MPU_RLAR_A_NSn. All writes to the registers are ignored.

field.name: LOCK
field.description: This 1-bit field provides a mechanism to limit writes to this register to protect its contents. Once set, this bit remains asserted until a system reset.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLE
enumeratedValue.description: This register is not locked and can be altered.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLE
enumeratedValue.description: This register is locked and cannot be altered until a system reset.

field.name: UNLOCK
field.description: Controls clock configuration registers access (for example, SLOWCLKDIV, BUSCLKDIV, AHBCLKDIV, FROHFDIV, FROLFDIV, PLLxCLKDIV, MRCC_xxx_CLKDIV, MRCC_xxx_CLKSEL, MRCC_GLB_xxx)

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLE
enumeratedValue.description: Updates are allowed to all clock configuration registers

enumeratedValue.name: FREEZE
enumeratedValue.description: Freezes all clock configuration registers update.

field.name: DIS_MBECC_ERR_INST

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLE
enumeratedValue.description: Disables bus error on multi-bit ECC error for instruction

field.name: DIS_MBECC_ERR_DATA

enumeratedValue.description: Enables bus error on multi-bit ECC error for data

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLE

field.name: TESTCODE
field.description: Used to store test code information before running TMR-RST/TMRSET BIST command

enumeratedValue.name: zz252
enumeratedValue.description: XADR fixed, no change at all

enumeratedValue.name: zz253
enumeratedValue.description: XADR increased by 1 after row. For READ operation, XADR increases by 1 after reading the last word of row. For PROG operation, XADR increases by 1 after NVSTR falls.

enumeratedValue.name: zz254
enumeratedValue.description: XADR increased for diagonal. For PROG-DIAGONAL operation, XADR is increased to create diagonal pattern.

enumeratedValue.name: zz255
enumeratedValue.description: XADR increased by sector. During ERASE operation, XADR increased by number of rows in a sector when NVSTR falls.

enumeratedValue.name: zz256
enumeratedValue.description: XADR inversed. XADR is inversed after reading one word or after programming one row when NVSTR falls.

enumeratedValue.name: zz257
enumeratedValue.description: XADR increased by 2 after row. For READ operation, XADR is increased by 2 after reading the last word of a row. For PROG operation, XADR is increased by 2 when NVSTR falls.

enumeratedValue.name: zz258
enumeratedValue.description: XADR[0] inversed. XADR[0] is inversed after reading one word or after programming one row when NVSTR falls.

enumeratedValue.name: zz259
enumeratedValue.description: XADR increased by 1. For READ operations only, XADR increased by 1 after each read cycle.

enumeratedValue.name: zz260
enumeratedValue.description: XADR decreased by 1 after row. For READ operations only, XADR is decreased by 1 after YADR decreases to 0.

enumeratedValue.name: zz261
enumeratedValue.description: XADR decreased by 1. For READ operations only, XADR is decreased by 1 after each read cycle.

enumeratedValue.name: zz242
enumeratedValue.description: YADR fixed, no change at all

enumeratedValue.name: zz243
enumeratedValue.description: YADR for ICKBD. For PROG and READ operations, YADR changed to generate inverse checkerboard pattern.

enumeratedValue.name: zz244
enumeratedValue.description: YADR for CKBD. For PROG and READ operations, YADR changed to generate checkerboard pattern.

enumeratedValue.name: zz245
enumeratedValue.description: YADR increased by 1. For READ operations, YADR increased by 1 after each read cycle. For PROG operations, YADR increased by 1 after YE falls.

enumeratedValue.name: zz246
enumeratedValue.description: YADR increased for diagonal. For PROG-DIAGONAL operation, YADR is increased to create diagonal pattern.

enumeratedValue.name: zz247
enumeratedValue.description: YADR inversed. YADR is inversed after reading one word or after programming one word when YE falls.

enumeratedValue.name: zz248
enumeratedValue.description: YADR[0] inversed. YADR[0] is inversed after reading one word or after programming one word when YE falls.

enumeratedValue.name: zz249
enumeratedValue.description: YADR increased by 1 after last row. For READ operations only, YADR is increased by 1 after XADR reaches last row.

enumeratedValue.name: zz250
enumeratedValue.description: YADR decreased by 1. For READ operations only, YADR is decreased by 1 after each read cycle.

enumeratedValue.name: zz251
enumeratedValue.description: YADR decreased by 1 after first row. For READ operations only, YADR is decreased by 1 after XADR decreases to 0.

enumeratedValue.name: zz232
enumeratedValue.description: CKBD pattern. For READ operations only, compare DOUT with checkerboard data pattern for each read cycle.

enumeratedValue.name: zz233
enumeratedValue.description: ICKBD pattern. For READ operations only, compare DOUT with inverse checkerboard data pattern for each read cycle.

enumeratedValue.name: zz234
enumeratedValue.description: Diagonal pattern. Used for READ operations only, compare DOUT to diagonal pattern.

enumeratedValue.name: zz235
enumeratedValue.description: Fixed data pattern. For READ operations, comparison to DOUT for selected groups; refer to R_ADR_CTRL[GRPSEL] for modules with multiple groups.

enumeratedValue.name: zz236
enumeratedValue.description: Random data pattern which will be generated based on the initial seed set in R_DATA; for READ operations, used for DOUT comparison of selected groups. For PROG operations, used to control DIN of selected groups.

enumeratedValue.name: zz237
enumeratedValue.description: DOUT based pattern. For READ operations only, DOUT of selected group will be latched in R_DATA. If more than one group is selected in R_ADR_CTRL[GRPSEL], the group with the lower index will be latched.

enumeratedValue.name: zz238
enumeratedValue.description: R_DATA based pattern. For READ operations, expected DOUT value of selected groups equals to R_DATA when XADR[0]==YADR[0] or ~R_DATA when XADR[0]!=YADR[0]. For PROG operations, DIN of selected groups equals R_DATA when XADR[0]==YADR[0] or ~R_DATA when XADR[0]!=YADR[0].

enumeratedValue.name: zz239
enumeratedValue.description: SCAN-IO pattern. For READ operations, control expected DOUT value of selected groups to SCAN-IO data pattern. For PROG operations, control DIN of selected groups to SCAN-IO data pattern.

enumeratedValue.name: zz240
enumeratedValue.description: REPAIR set. For PROG operation to IFR1(7,1) and IFR1(7,2), R_REPAIR0_0 and R_REPAIR0_1 or R_REPAIR1_0 and R_REPAIR1_1 will control DIN. For READ operation on IFR1(7,1) and IFR1(7,2), DOUT will be compared against R_REPAIR0_0 and R_REPAIR0_1 or R_REPAIR1_0 andR_REPAIR1_1. When this option is selected, only one flash block can be selected.

enumeratedValue.name: zz241
enumeratedValue.description: REPAIR load. For READ operation only, DOUT from IFR1(7,1) and IFR1(7,2) is loaded to R_REPAIR0 and R_REPAIR1.

enumeratedValue.name: zz229
enumeratedValue.description: Expected data is compared to DOUT

enumeratedValue.name: zz230
enumeratedValue.description: Expected data (only 0s are considered) are compared to DOUT

enumeratedValue.name: zz231
enumeratedValue.description: Expected data (only 1s are considered) are compared to DOUT

enumeratedValue.name: zz262
enumeratedValue.description: One YE pulse will program one data slice group

enumeratedValue.name: zz263
enumeratedValue.description: One YE pulse will program two data slice groups

enumeratedValue.name: zz264
enumeratedValue.description: One YE pulse will program three data slice groups (reserved)

enumeratedValue.name: zz265
enumeratedValue.description: One YE pulse will program four data slice groups

enumeratedValue.name: zz266
enumeratedValue.description: One YE pulse will program five data slice groups (reserved)

enumeratedValue.name: zz267
enumeratedValue.description: One YE pulse will program six data slice groups (reserved)

enumeratedValue.name: zz268
enumeratedValue.description: One YE pulse will program seven data slice groups (reserved)

enumeratedValue.name: zz269
enumeratedValue.description: One YE pulse will program eight data slice groups (reserved)

enumeratedValue.name: zz284
enumeratedValue.description: Loop is disabled; selected BIST operation is run once

enumeratedValue.name: zz285
enumeratedValue.description: Loop is enabled; XADR increments by 1 XADR increments by 1 for each new loop. Stops when total loop count meets LOOPCNT+1.

enumeratedValue.name: zz286
enumeratedValue.description: Loop is enabled; YADR increments by 1 YADR increments by 1 for each new loop. Stops when total loop count meets LOOPCNT+1.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Treat a received NACK as an ACK

enumeratedValue.name: IPBUS
enumeratedValue.description: The IPBus clock is used as the clock for the local prescaler and counter.

enumeratedValue.name: EXT_CLK
enumeratedValue.description: EXT_CLK is used as the clock for the local prescaler and counter.

enumeratedValue.name: AUX_CLK
enumeratedValue.description: Submodule 0's clock (AUX_CLK) is used as the source clock for the local prescaler and counter. This setting should not be used in submodule 0 as it forces the clock to logic 0.

enumeratedValue.name: LOCAL
enumeratedValue.description: The local RELOAD signal is used to reload registers.

enumeratedValue.name: MASTER
enumeratedValue.description: The master RELOAD signal (from submodule 0) is used to reload registers. This setting should not be used in submodule 0 as it forces the RELOAD signal to logic 0.

enumeratedValue.name: LOCAL
enumeratedValue.description: The local force signal, CTRL2[FORCE], from this submodule is used to force updates.

enumeratedValue.name: MASTER
enumeratedValue.description: The master force signal from submodule 0 is used to force updates. This setting should not be used in submodule 0 as it holds the FORCE OUTPUT signal to logic 0.

enumeratedValue.name: LOCAL_RELOAD
enumeratedValue.description: The local reload signal from this submodule is used to force updates without regard to the state of LDOK.

enumeratedValue.name: MASTER_RELOAD
enumeratedValue.description: The master reload signal from submodule0 is used to force updates if LDOK is set. This setting should not be used in submodule0 as it holds the FORCE OUTPUT signal to logic 0.

enumeratedValue.name: LOCAL_SYNC
enumeratedValue.description: The local sync signal from this submodule is used to force updates.

enumeratedValue.name: MASTER_SYNC
enumeratedValue.description: The master sync signal from submodule0 is used to force updates. This setting should not be used in submodule0 as it holds the FORCE OUTPUT signal to logic 0.

enumeratedValue.name: EXT_FORCE
enumeratedValue.description: The external force signal, EXT_FORCE, from outside the eFlexPWM module causes updates.

enumeratedValue.name: EXT_SYNC
enumeratedValue.description: The external sync signal, EXT_SYNC, from outside the eFlexPWM module causes updates.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Initialization from a FORCE_OUT is disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Initialization from a FORCE_OUT is enabled.

enumeratedValue.name: MASTER_RELOAD
enumeratedValue.description: Master reload from submodule 0 causes initialization. This setting should not be used in submodule 0 as it forces the INIT signal to logic 0. The submodule counter will only re-initialize when a master reload occurs.

enumeratedValue.name: MASTER_SYNC
enumeratedValue.description: Master sync from submodule 0 causes initialization. This setting should not be used in submodule 0 as it forces the INIT signal to logic 0.

enumeratedValue.name: COMPLEMENTARY
enumeratedValue.description: PWM_A and PWM_B form a complementary PWM pair.

enumeratedValue.name: INDEPENDENT
enumeratedValue.description: PWM_A and PWM_B outputs are independent PWMs.

enumeratedValue.name: NEXT_PWM_RELOAD
enumeratedValue.description: Buffered registers of this submodule are loaded and take effect at the next PWM reload if MCTRL[LDOK] is set.

enumeratedValue.name: MTCTRL_LDOK_SET
enumeratedValue.description: Buffered registers of this submodule are loaded and take effect immediately upon MCTRL[LDOK] being set. In this case, it is not necessary to set CTRL[FULL] or CTRL[HALF].

field.name: SPLIT
field.description: Split the DBLPWM signal to PWM_A and PWM_B

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: DBLPWM is not split. PWM_A and PWM_B each have double pulses.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: DBLPWM is split to PWM_A and PWM_B.

enumeratedValue.name: EQUAL_TO
enumeratedValue.description: The VAL* registers and the PWM counter are compared using an "equal to" method. This means that PWM edges are only produced when the counter is equal to one of the VAL* register values. This implies that a PWM_A output that is high at the end of a period maintains this state until a match with VAL3 clears the output in the following period.

enumeratedValue.name: EQUAL_TO_OR_GREATER_THAN
enumeratedValue.description: The VAL* registers and the PWM counter are compared using an "equal to or greater than" method. This means that PWM edges are produced when the counter is equal to or greater than one of the VAL* register values. This implies that a PWM_A output that is high at the end of a period could go low at the start of the next period if the starting counter value is greater than (but not necessarily equal to) the new VAL3 value.

enumeratedValue.name: LOGIC_0
enumeratedValue.description: Output is forced to logic 0 state prior to consideration of output polarity control.

enumeratedValue.name: LOGIC_1
enumeratedValue.description: Output is forced to logic 1 state prior to consideration of output polarity control.

enumeratedValue.name: TRISTATED_2
enumeratedValue.description: Output is put in a high-impedance state.

enumeratedValue.name: TRISTATED_3
enumeratedValue.description: Output is put in a high-impedance state.

enumeratedValue.name: LOGIC_0
enumeratedValue.description: Output is forced to logic 0 state prior to consideration of output polarity control.

enumeratedValue.name: LOGIC_1
enumeratedValue.description: Output is forced to logic 1 state prior to consideration of output polarity control.

enumeratedValue.name: TRISTATED_2
enumeratedValue.description: Output is put in a high-impedance state.

enumeratedValue.name: TRISTATED_3
enumeratedValue.description: Output is put in a high-impedance state.

enumeratedValue.name: LOGIC_0
enumeratedValue.description: Output is forced to logic 0 state prior to consideration of output polarity control.

enumeratedValue.name: LOGIC_1
enumeratedValue.description: Output is forced to logic 1 state prior to consideration of output polarity control.

enumeratedValue.name: TRISTATED_2
enumeratedValue.description: Output is put in a high-impedance state.

enumeratedValue.name: TRISTATED_3
enumeratedValue.description: Output is put in a high-impedance state.

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_INVERTED
enumeratedValue.description: PWM_X output not inverted. A high level on the PWM_X pin represents the "on" or "active" state.

enumeratedValue.name: INVERTED
enumeratedValue.description: PWM_X output inverted. A low level on the PWM_X pin represents the "on" or "active" state.

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_INVERTED
enumeratedValue.description: PWM_B output not inverted. A high level on the PWM_B pin represents the "on" or "active" state.

enumeratedValue.name: INVERTED
enumeratedValue.description: PWM_B output inverted. A low level on the PWM_B pin represents the "on" or "active" state.

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_INVERTED
enumeratedValue.description: PWM_A output not inverted. A high level on the PWM_A pin represents the "on" or "active" state.

enumeratedValue.name: INVERTED
enumeratedValue.description: PWM_A output inverted. A low level on the PWM_A pin represents the "on" or "active" state.

enumeratedValue.name: NO_EVENT
enumeratedValue.description: No compare event has occurred for a particular VALx value.

enumeratedValue.name: EVENT
enumeratedValue.description: A compare event has occurred for a particular VALx value.

enumeratedValue.name: NO_FLAG
enumeratedValue.description: No new reload cycle since last STS[RF] clearing

enumeratedValue.name: FLAG
enumeratedValue.description: New reload cycle since last STS[RF] clearing

enumeratedValue.name: FLAG
enumeratedValue.description: Reload signal occurred with non-coherent data and MCTRL[LDOK] = 0.

enumeratedValue.name: NO_FLAG
enumeratedValue.description: No register update has occurred since last reload.

enumeratedValue.name: FLAG
enumeratedValue.description: At least one of the double buffered registers has been updated since the last reload.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: The corresponding STS[CMPF] bit will not cause an interrupt request.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: The corresponding STS[CMPF] bit will cause an interrupt request.

enumeratedValue.name: EXCEEDFIFO
enumeratedValue.description: Exceeding a FIFO watermark sets the DMA read request. This requires at least one of DMAEN[CX1DE], or DMAEN[CX0DE] to be set to determine which watermark(s) the DMA request is sensitive.

enumeratedValue.name: LOCAL_SYNC
enumeratedValue.description: A local synchronization (VAL1 matches counter) sets the read DMA request.

enumeratedValue.name: LOCAL_RELOAD
enumeratedValue.description: A local reload (STS[RF] being set) sets the read DMA request.

enumeratedValue.name: OR
enumeratedValue.description: Selected FIFO watermarks are OR'ed together.

enumeratedValue.name: AND
enumeratedValue.description: Selected FIFO watermarks are AND'ed together.

enumeratedValue.name: VAL0
enumeratedValue.description: PWM_OUT_TRIG0 will set when the counter value matches the VAL0 value.

enumeratedValue.name: VAL1
enumeratedValue.description: PWM_OUT_TRIG1 will set when the counter value matches the VAL1 value.

enumeratedValue.name: VAL2
enumeratedValue.description: PWM_OUT_TRIG0 will set when the counter value matches the VAL2 value.

enumeratedValue.name: VAL3
enumeratedValue.description: PWM_OUT_TRIG1 will set when the counter value matches the VAL3 value.

enumeratedValue.name: VAL4
enumeratedValue.description: PWM_OUT_TRIG0 will set when the counter value matches the VAL4 value.

enumeratedValue.name: VAL5
enumeratedValue.description: PWM_OUT_TRIG1 will set when the counter value matches the VAL5 value.

enumeratedValue.name: EVERYPWM
enumeratedValue.description: Trigger outputs are generated during every PWM period even if the PWM is not reloaded every period due to CTRL[LDFQ] being non-zero.

enumeratedValue.name: FINALPWM
enumeratedValue.description: Trigger outputs are generated only during the final PWM period prior to a reload opportunity when the PWM is not reloaded every period due to CTRL[LDFQ] being non-zero.

enumeratedValue.description: Route the PWM_OUT_TRIG1 signal to PWM_MUX_TRIG1 port.

enumeratedValue.description: Route the PWM_B output to the PWM_MUX_TRIG1 port.

enumeratedValue.name: PWM_OUT_TRIG0_SIGNAL
enumeratedValue.description: Route the PWM_OUT_TRIG0 signal to PWM_MUX_TRIG0 port.

enumeratedValue.name: PWMA_OUTPUT
enumeratedValue.description: Route the PWM_A output to the PWM_MUX_TRIG0 port.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Input capture operation as specified by CAPTCTRLX[EDGXx] is enabled.

enumeratedValue.name: PWM_X
enumeratedValue.description: Raw PWM_X input signal selected as source.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Edge counter disabled and held in reset

enumeratedValue.name: IPBUS
enumeratedValue.description: The IPBus clock is used as the clock for the local prescaler and counter.

enumeratedValue.name: EXT_CLK
enumeratedValue.description: EXT_CLK is used as the clock for the local prescaler and counter.

enumeratedValue.name: AUX_CLK
enumeratedValue.description: Submodule 0's clock (AUX_CLK) is used as the source clock for the local prescaler and counter. This setting should not be used in submodule 0 as it forces the clock to logic 0.

enumeratedValue.name: LOCAL
enumeratedValue.description: The local RELOAD signal is used to reload registers.

enumeratedValue.name: MASTER
enumeratedValue.description: The master RELOAD signal (from submodule 0) is used to reload registers. This setting should not be used in submodule 0 as it forces the RELOAD signal to logic 0.

enumeratedValue.name: LOCAL
enumeratedValue.description: The local force signal, CTRL2[FORCE], from this submodule is used to force updates.

enumeratedValue.name: MASTER
enumeratedValue.description: The master force signal from submodule 0 is used to force updates. This setting should not be used in submodule 0 as it holds the FORCE OUTPUT signal to logic 0.

enumeratedValue.name: LOCAL_RELOAD
enumeratedValue.description: The local reload signal from this submodule is used to force updates without regard to the state of LDOK.

enumeratedValue.name: MASTER_RELOAD
enumeratedValue.description: The master reload signal from submodule0 is used to force updates if LDOK is set. This setting should not be used in submodule0 as it holds the FORCE OUTPUT signal to logic 0.

enumeratedValue.name: LOCAL_SYNC
enumeratedValue.description: The local sync signal from this submodule is used to force updates.

enumeratedValue.name: MASTER_SYNC
enumeratedValue.description: The master sync signal from submodule0 is used to force updates. This setting should not be used in submodule0 as it holds the FORCE OUTPUT signal to logic 0.

enumeratedValue.name: EXT_FORCE
enumeratedValue.description: The external force signal, EXT_FORCE, from outside the eFlexPWM module causes updates.

enumeratedValue.name: EXT_SYNC
enumeratedValue.description: The external sync signal, EXT_SYNC, from outside the eFlexPWM module causes updates.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Initialization from a FORCE_OUT is disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Initialization from a FORCE_OUT is enabled.

enumeratedValue.name: MASTER_RELOAD
enumeratedValue.description: Master reload from submodule 0 causes initialization. This setting should not be used in submodule 0 as it forces the INIT signal to logic 0. The submodule counter will only re-initialize when a master reload occurs.

enumeratedValue.name: MASTER_SYNC
enumeratedValue.description: Master sync from submodule 0 causes initialization. This setting should not be used in submodule 0 as it forces the INIT signal to logic 0.

enumeratedValue.name: COMPLEMENTARY
enumeratedValue.description: PWM_A and PWM_B form a complementary PWM pair.

enumeratedValue.name: INDEPENDENT
enumeratedValue.description: PWM_A and PWM_B outputs are independent PWMs.

enumeratedValue.name: NEXT_PWM_RELOAD
enumeratedValue.description: Buffered registers of this submodule are loaded and take effect at the next PWM reload if MCTRL[LDOK] is set.

enumeratedValue.name: MTCTRL_LDOK_SET
enumeratedValue.description: Buffered registers of this submodule are loaded and take effect immediately upon MCTRL[LDOK] being set. In this case, it is not necessary to set CTRL[FULL] or CTRL[HALF].

field.name: SPLIT
field.description: Split the DBLPWM signal to PWM_A and PWM_B

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: DBLPWM is not split. PWM_A and PWM_B each have double pulses.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: DBLPWM is split to PWM_A and PWM_B.

enumeratedValue.name: EQUAL_TO
enumeratedValue.description: The VAL* registers and the PWM counter are compared using an "equal to" method. This means that PWM edges are only produced when the counter is equal to one of the VAL* register values. This implies that a PWM_A output that is high at the end of a period maintains this state until a match with VAL3 clears the output in the following period.

enumeratedValue.name: EQUAL_TO_OR_GREATER_THAN
enumeratedValue.description: The VAL* registers and the PWM counter are compared using an "equal to or greater than" method. This means that PWM edges are produced when the counter is equal to or greater than one of the VAL* register values. This implies that a PWM_A output that is high at the end of a period could go low at the start of the next period if the starting counter value is greater than (but not necessarily equal to) the new VAL3 value.

enumeratedValue.name: LOGIC_0
enumeratedValue.description: Output is forced to logic 0 state prior to consideration of output polarity control.

enumeratedValue.name: LOGIC_1
enumeratedValue.description: Output is forced to logic 1 state prior to consideration of output polarity control.

enumeratedValue.name: TRISTATED_2
enumeratedValue.description: Output is put in a high-impedance state.

enumeratedValue.name: TRISTATED_3
enumeratedValue.description: Output is put in a high-impedance state.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Load prescaler, modulus, and PWM values of the corresponding submodule.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: PWM counter is started in the corresponding submodule.

enumeratedValue.description: PWM23 is used to generate complementary PWM pair in the corresponding submodule.

enumeratedValue.name: PWM45
enumeratedValue.description: PWM45 is used to generate complementary PWM pair in the corresponding submodule.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED_LOCKED
enumeratedValue.description: Write protection off and locked until chip reset.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED_LOCKED
enumeratedValue.description: Write protection on and locked until chip reset.

field.name: STRETCH_CNT_PRSC
field.description: Stretch IPBus clock count prescaler for mux0_trig/mux1_trig/out0_trig/out1_trig/pwma_trig/pwmb_trig

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Stretch count is zero, no stretch.

enumeratedValue.name: NORMAL
enumeratedValue.description: Normal mode. PWM outputs disabled by this fault are not enabled until FSTS[FFLAGx] is clear at the start of a half cycle or full cycle depending on the states of FSTS[FHALF] and FSTS[FFULL] without regard to the state of FSTS[FFPINx]. If neither FHALF nor FFULL is set, then the fault condition cannot be cleared. The PWM outputs disabled by this fault input will not be re-enabled until the actual FAULTx input signal de-asserts since the fault input will combinationally disable the PWM outputs (as programmed in DISMAPn).

enumeratedValue.name: SAFE
enumeratedValue.description: Safe mode. PWM outputs disabled by this fault are not enabled until FSTS[FFLAGx] is clear and FSTS[FFPINx] is clear at the start of a half cycle or full cycle depending on the states of FSTS[FHALF] and FSTS[FFULL]. If neither FHLAF nor FFULL is set, then the fault condition cannot be cleared.

enumeratedValue.name: MANUAL
enumeratedValue.description: Manual fault clearing. PWM outputs disabled by this fault are not enabled until FSTS[FFLAGx] is clear at the start of a half cycle or full cycle depending on the states of FSTS[FHALF] and FSTS[FFULL]. If neither FFULL nor FHALF is set, then the fault condition cannot be cleared. This is further controlled by FCTRL[FSAFE].

enumeratedValue.name: AUTOMATIC
enumeratedValue.description: Automatic fault clearing. PWM outputs disabled by this fault are enabled when FSTS[FFPINx] is clear at the start of a half cycle or full cycle depending on the states of FSTS[FHALF] and FSTS[FFULL] without regard to the state of FSTS[FFLAGx]. If neither FFULL nor FHALF is set, then the fault condition cannot be cleared.

enumeratedValue.name: LOGIC_0
enumeratedValue.description: A logic 0 on the fault input indicates a fault condition.

enumeratedValue.name: LOGIC_1
enumeratedValue.description: A logic 1 on the fault input indicates a fault condition.

enumeratedValue.name: NO_FLAG
enumeratedValue.description: No fault on the FAULTx pin.

enumeratedValue.name: PWM_OUTPUTS_NOT_REENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: PWM outputs are not re-enabled at the start of a full cycle

enumeratedValue.name: PWM_OUTPUTS_REENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: PWM outputs are re-enabled at the start of a full cycle

enumeratedValue.name: PWM_OUTPUTS_NOT_REENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: PWM outputs are not re-enabled at the start of a half cycle.

enumeratedValue.name: PWM_OUTPUTS_REENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: PWM outputs are re-enabled at the start of a half cycle (as defined by VAL0).

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Fault input glitch stretching is disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Input fault signals are stretched to at least 2 IPBus clock cycles.

field.name: NOCOMB
field.description: No Combinational Path From Fault Input To PWM Output

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: There is a combinational link from the fault inputs to the PWM outputs. The fault inputs are combined with the filtered and latched fault signals to disable the PWM outputs.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: The direct combinational path from the fault inputs to the PWM outputs is disabled and the filtered and latched fault signals are used to disable the PWM outputs.

field.name: PCS

enumeratedValue.name: prescale0101

enumeratedValue.name: prescale0110

enumeratedValue.name: prescale0111
enumeratedValue.description: Prescaler divides the prescaler clock by 256; glitch filter recognizes change on input pin after 128 rising clock edges

enumeratedValue.name: prescale1000

enumeratedValue.name: prescale1001
enumeratedValue.description: Prescaler divides the prescaler clock by 1024; glitch filter recognizes change on input pin after 512 rising clock edges

enumeratedValue.name: prescale1010
enumeratedValue.description: Prescaler divides the prescaler clock by 2048; glitch filter recognizes change on input pin after 1024 rising clock edges

enumeratedValue.name: prescale1011
enumeratedValue.description: Prescaler divides the prescaler clock by 4096; glitch filter recognizes change on input pin after 2048 rising clock edges

enumeratedValue.name: prescale1100

enumeratedValue.name: prescale1101

enumeratedValue.name: ABORT_CURRENT_ON_PRIORITY
enumeratedValue.description: If a higher priority trigger is detected during command processing, the current conversion is aborted and the new command specified by the trigger is started.

enumeratedValue.name: FINISH_CURRENT_ON_PRIORITY
enumeratedValue.description: If a higher priority trigger is received during command processing, the current command is stopped after completing the current conversion. If averaging is enabled, the averaging loop will be completed. However, CMDHa[LOOP] will be ignored and the higher priority trigger will be serviced.

enumeratedValue.name: FINISH_SEQUENCE_ON_PRIORITY
enumeratedValue.description: If a higher priority trigger is received during command processing, the current command will be completed (averaging, looping, compare) before servicing the higher priority trigger.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Trigger sequences interrupted by a high priority trigger exception are not automatically resumed or restarted.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Trigger sequences interrupted by a high priority trigger exception are automatically resumed or restarted.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Trigger sequences interrupted by a high priority trigger exception is automatically restarted.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Trigger sequences interrupted by a high priority trigger exception is resumed from the command executing before the exception.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: High priority trigger exceptions are enabled.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: High priority trigger exceptions are disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_PRE_ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: ADC analog circuits are only enabled while conversions are active. Performance is affected due to analog startup delays.

enumeratedValue.name: PRE_ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: ADC analog circuits are pre-enabled and ready to execute conversions without startup delays (at the cost of higher DC current consumption). Note that a single power up delay (CFG[PUDLY]) is executed immediately once PWREN is set, and any detected trigger does not begin ADC operation until the power up delay time has passed. After this initial delay expires the analog remains pre-enabled and no additional delays are executed.

field.name: NO_PRGM
field.description: If set, below mentioned TRNG configuration registers cannot be programmed: Oscillator 2 Control Register (OSC2_CTL): TRNG Entropy Generation Control [1:0] Oscillator 2 Divider [3:2] Oscillator Fail Safe Limit [13:12] Oscillator Fail Safe Test [14] TRNG Seed Control Register (SDCTL) TRNG Frequency Count Minimum Limit Register (FRQMIN) TRNG Frequency Count Maximum Limit Register (FRQMAX) TRNG Poker Range Register (PKRRNG) TRNG Poker Maximum Limit Register (PKRMAX) TRNG Statistical Check Monobit Limit Register (SCML) TRNG Statistical Check Run Length 1 Limit Register (SCR1L) TRNG Statistical Check Run Length 2 Limit Register (SCR2L) TRNG Statistical Check Run Length 3 Limit Register (SCR3L) TRNG Statistical Check Run Length 4 Limit Register (SCR4L) TRNG Statistical Check Run Length 5 Limit Register (SCR5L) TRNG Statistical Check Run Length 6 Limit Register (SCR6PL) TRNG Sparse Bit Limit Register (SBLIM) TRNG Miscellaneous Control Register (MCTL): Sample Mode [1:0] Oscillator Divider [3:2] Reset Defaults [6] Force System Clock [7] Long Runs Continuation Mode [14] After this bit has been written to a 1, it cannot be changed

enumeratedValue.name: NO_PRGM_OFF
enumeratedValue.description: TRNG configuration registers can be modified.

enumeratedValue.name: NO_PRGM_ON
enumeratedValue.description: TRNG configuration registers cannot be modified.

enumeratedValue.name: HW_ERR_CLEAR
enumeratedValue.description: Clears the INT_STATUS[HW_ERR] bit. Will automatically set after writing.

enumeratedValue.name: HW_ERR_ON
enumeratedValue.description: Enables the INT_STATUS[HW_ERR] bit to be set, thereby enabling interrupt generation for the HW_ERR condition.

enumeratedValue.name: ENT_VAL_CLEAR
enumeratedValue.description: Clears the INT_STATUS[ENT_VAL] bit. Will automatically set after writing.

enumeratedValue.name: ENT_VAL_ON
enumeratedValue.description: Enables the INT_STATUS[ENT_VAL] bit to be set, thereby enabling interrupt generation for the ENT_VAL condition.

enumeratedValue.name: FRQ_CT_FAIL_CLEAR
enumeratedValue.description: Clears the INT_STATUS[FRQ_CT_FAIL] bit. Will automatically set after writing.

enumeratedValue.name: FRQ_CT_FAIL_ON
enumeratedValue.description: Enables the INT_STATUS[FRQ_CT_FAIL] bit to be set, thereby enabling interrupt generation for the FRQ_CT_FAIL condition.

enumeratedValue.name: INTG_FLT_CLEAR
enumeratedValue.description: Clears the INT_STATUS[INTG_FLT] bit. Will automatically set after writing.

enumeratedValue.name: INTG_FLT_ON
enumeratedValue.description: Enables the INT_STATUS[INTG_FLT] bit to be set, thereby enabling interrupt generation for the INTG_FLT condition.

field.name: HW_ERR
field.description: Read: TRNG Error. Any error in the TRNG will trigger this interrupt.

enumeratedValue.name: ENT_VAL_INVALID
enumeratedValue.description: Busy generating entropy. Any value read from the Entropy registers is invalid.

enumeratedValue.name: ENT_VAL_VALID
enumeratedValue.description: Values read from the Entropy registers are valid.

enumeratedValue.name: FRQ_CT_FAIL_NO_ERR
enumeratedValue.description: No hardware nor self test frequency errors.

enumeratedValue.name: FRQ_CT_FAIL_ERR
enumeratedValue.description: The frequency counter has detected a failure.

field.name: INTG_FLT
field.description: Integrity Fault. An internal fault has occurred.

enumeratedValue.name: INTG_FLT_NO_ERR
enumeratedValue.description: No internal fault has been detected.

enumeratedValue.name: OSC2_DIV_DIV8
enumeratedValue.description: Unused, (bit field cannot be written to this value)

enumeratedValue.name: OSC2_DIV_DIV1
enumeratedValue.description: Use ring oscillator 2 with no divide

enumeratedValue.name: OSC2_OUT_EN_0
enumeratedValue.description: Ring oscillator 2 output is gated to an output pad.

enumeratedValue.name: OSC2_OUT_EN_1
enumeratedValue.description: Allows external viewing of divided-by-2 ring oscillator 2 if MCTL[PRGM] = 1 mode is also selected, else ring oscillator 2 output is gated to an output pad.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLE
enumeratedValue.description: If TRNG_ENT_CTL = 10b, valid frequency count may be read from OSC2_FRQCNT.

enumeratedValue.name: OSC_FAILSAFE_LMT_4K
enumeratedValue.description: The limit N is 4096 (2^12) system clocks.

enumeratedValue.name: OSC_FAILSAFE_LMT_64K
enumeratedValue.description: The limit N is 65536 (2^16) system clocks. (default)

enumeratedValue.name: OSC_FAILSAFE_LMT_4M
enumeratedValue.description: N is 2^22 system clocks (full range of the counter being used).

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLE
enumeratedValue.description: Disables oscillator 2 while in dual-oscillator mode (TRNG_ENT_CTL = 01b).

field.name: MIN_REV
field.description: Shows the IP's Minor revision of the TRNG.

field.name: MAJ_REV
field.description: Shows the IP's Major revision of the TRNG

field.name: CONFIG_OPT
field.description: Shows the IP's Configuaration options for the TRNG.

field.name: ECO_REV
field.description: Shows the IP's ECO revision of the TRNG.

field.name: INTG_OPT
field.description: Shows the integration options for the TRNG.

field.name: ERA
field.description: Shows the ERA of the TRNG.

enumeratedValue.name: CYCLE_4
enumeratedValue.description: Time Prescaler Register overflows every 32768 clock cycles.

enumeratedValue.name: CYCLE_5
enumeratedValue.description: Time Prescaler Register overflows every 32767 clock cycles.

enumeratedValue.name: CYCLE_6
enumeratedValue.description: Time Prescaler Register overflows every 32642 clock cycles.

enumeratedValue.name: CYCLE_7
enumeratedValue.description: Time Prescaler Register overflows every 32641 clock cycles.

enumeratedValue.name: CYCLE_1
enumeratedValue.description: Time Prescaler Register overflows every 32896 clock cycles.

enumeratedValue.name: CYCLE_2
enumeratedValue.description: Time Prescaler Register overflows every 32895 clock cycles.

enumeratedValue.name: CYCLE_3
enumeratedValue.description: Time Prescaler Register overflows every 32769 clock cycles.

enumeratedValue.name: RESET
enumeratedValue.description: Resets all RTC registers except for this bit . This bit is cleared by POR and by software explicitly clearing it.

enumeratedValue.name: NON_WRITABLE
enumeratedValue.description: Registers cannot be written when locked.

enumeratedValue.name: WRITABLE
enumeratedValue.description: Registers can be written when locked under limited conditions.

enumeratedValue.name: CLOCK_32
enumeratedValue.description: RTC prescaler increments using 32.768 kHz clock.

enumeratedValue.name: CLOCK_LPO
enumeratedValue.description: RTC prescaler increments using 16.384 kHz LPO. Bit [0] of the prescaler is ignored.

enumeratedValue.name: INVALID
enumeratedValue.description: Time is invalid and time counter is read as zero.

enumeratedValue.name: OVERFLOW
enumeratedValue.description: Time overflow has occurred and time counter reads as zero.

enumeratedValue.name: LOCKED
enumeratedValue.description: Time Compensation Register is locked and writes are ignored.

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_LOCKED
enumeratedValue.description: Time Compensation Register is not locked and writes complete as normal.

enumeratedValue.name: LOCKED
enumeratedValue.description: Control Register is locked and writes are ignored.

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_LOCKED
enumeratedValue.description: Control Register is not locked and writes complete as normal.

enumeratedValue.name: LOCKED
enumeratedValue.description: Status Register is locked and writes are ignored.

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_LOCKED
enumeratedValue.description: Status Register is not locked and writes complete as normal.

enumeratedValue.name: LOCKED
enumeratedValue.description: Lock Register is locked and writes are ignored.

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_LOCKED
enumeratedValue.description: Lock Register is not locked and writes complete as normal.

enumeratedValue.name: irqc13

enumeratedValue.name: irqc13
enumeratedValue.description: Enable active-high trigger output; ISF on rising edge (pin state is ORed with other enabled triggers to generate the output trigger for use by other peripherals)

enumeratedValue.name: irqc14
enumeratedValue.description: Enable active-low trigger output; ISF on falling edge (pin state is inverted and ORed with other enabled triggers to generate the output trigger for use by other peripherals)

enumeratedValue.name: INTERRUPT_DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: counting down to 0 does not assert the SysTick exception request

enumeratedValue.name: INTERRUPT_ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: counting down to 0 asserts the SysTick exception request

field.name: COUNTFLAG
field.description: Returns 1 if timer counted to 0 since the last read of this register.

field.name: RELOAD
field.description: Value to load into the SysTick Current Value Register when the counter reaches 0

field.name: CURRENT
field.description: Reads current counter value at the time the register is accessed. Any write to the register clears the register to 0.

field.name: TENMS
field.description: Reload value to use for 10ms timing

field.name: SKEW
field.description: Indicates whether the TENMS value is exact

enumeratedValue.name: INEXACT_VALUE
enumeratedValue.description: 10ms calibration value is inexact, because of the clock frequency

field.name: NOREF
field.description: Indicates whether the device provides an alternative reference clock

enumeratedValue.name: CLOCK_PROVIDED
enumeratedValue.description: The alternative reference clock is provided

enumeratedValue.name: CLOCK_DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: The alternative reference clock is not provided

field.name: INTID
field.description: Interrupt ID of the interrupt to trigger, in the range 0-479.

register.name: AIRCR
register.description: Application Interrupt and Reset Control Register

field.name: VECTCLRACTIVE
field.description: Reserved for Debug use. This bit reads as 0. When writing to the register you must write 0 to this bit, otherwise behavior is UNPREDICTABLE. This bit is not banked between Security states.

field.name: SYSRESETREQ
field.description: System reset request. This bit allows software or a debugger to request a system reset. This bit is not banked between Security states. RW if SYSRESETREQS is 0. When SYSRESETREQS is set to 1, from Non-secure state this bit acts as RAZ/WI.

enumeratedValue.name: NO_REQUEST
enumeratedValue.description: Do not request a system reset.

field.name: SYSRESETREQS
field.description: System reset request, Secure state only. The value of this bit defines whether the SYSRESETREQ bit is functional for Non-secure use. This bit is not banked between Security states. RW from Secure State and RAZ/WI from Non-secure state.

enumeratedValue.name: SECURE_AND_NON_SECURE
enumeratedValue.description: SYSRESETREQ functionality is available to both Security states.

enumeratedValue.name: SECURE_ONLY
enumeratedValue.description: SYSRESETREQ functionality is only available to Secure state.

field.name: PRIGROUP
field.description: Interrupt priority grouping field. This field determines the split of group priority from subpriority. This bit is banked between Security states

field.name: BFHFNMINS
field.description: BusFault, HardFault, and NMI Non-secure enable. The value of this bit defines whether BusFault and NMI exceptions are Non-secure, and whether exceptions target the Non-secure HardFault exception. This bit is not banked between Security states. RW from Secure-state and RO from Non-secure state.

enumeratedValue.name: SECURE
enumeratedValue.description: BusFault, HardFault, and NMI are Secure.

enumeratedValue.name: NON_SECURE
enumeratedValue.description: BusFault and NMI are Non-secure and exceptions can target Non-secure HardFault.

field.name: PRIS
field.description: Prioritize Secure exceptions. The value of this bit defines whether Secure exception priority boosting is enabled. This bit is not banked between Security states. RW from Secure state and RAZ/WI from Non-secure state.

enumeratedValue.name: SAME_PRIORITY
enumeratedValue.description: Priority ranges of Secure and Non-secure exceptions are identical

field.name: ENDIANNESS
field.description: Data endianness bit. This bit is not banked between Security states.

field.name: VECTKEY
field.description: Register key: Reads as 0xFA05. On writes, write 0x5FA to VECTKEY, otherwise the write is ignored. This Field is not banked between Security states.

register.name: SCR
register.description: The SCR controls features of entry to and exit from low-power state.

field.name: SLEEPONEXIT
field.description: Indicates sleep-on-exit when returning from Handler mode to Thread mode. Setting this bit to 1 enables an interrupt driven application to avoid returning to an empty main application. This bit is banked between Security states.

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_SLEEP
enumeratedValue.description: Do not sleep when returning to Thread mode.

enumeratedValue.name: SLEEP
enumeratedValue.description: Enter sleep, or deep sleep, on return from an ISR

field.name: SLEEPDEEP
field.description: Controls whether the processor uses sleep or deep sleep as its low-power mode. This bit is not banked between Security states.

field.name: SLEEPDEEPS
field.description: Controls whether the SLEEPDEEP bit is only accessible from the Secure state. This bit in only accessible from the Secure state, and behaves as RAZ/WI when accessed from the Nonsecure state. This bit is not banked between Security states.

enumeratedValue.name: SECURE_AND_NON_SECURE
enumeratedValue.description: The SLEEPDEEP bit is accessible from both Security states.

enumeratedValue.name: SECURE_ONLY
enumeratedValue.description: The SLEEPDEEP bit behaves as RAZ/WI when accessed from the Non-secure state.

field.name: SEVONPEND
field.description: Send Event on Pending bit. When an event or interrupt enters pending state, the event signal wakes up the processor from WFE. If the processor is not waiting for an event, the event is registered and affects the next WFE. The processor also wakes up on execution of an SEV instruction or an external event. This bit is banked between Security states.

enumeratedValue.name: EXCLUDE_DISABLED_INTERRUPTS
enumeratedValue.description: Only enabled interrupts or events can wakeup the processor, disabled interrupts are excluded.

enumeratedValue.name: INCLUDE_DISABLED_INTERRUPTS
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled events and all interrupts, including disabled interrupts, can wakeup the processor

register.name: SHCSR
register.description: System Handler Control and State Register

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_ACTIVE
enumeratedValue.description: Debug monitor exception is not active.

enumeratedValue.name: ACCESS_DENIED
enumeratedValue.description: Access Denied. Any attempted accesses to this coprocessor generates a NOCP UsageFault.

enumeratedValue.name: PRIVILEGED_ONLY
enumeratedValue.description: Privileged access only. An unprivileged access generates a NOCP UsageFault.

enumeratedValue.name: FULL_ACCESS
enumeratedValue.description: Full access. Full access rights for this coprocessor.
